para.sentence: Let A_{1},A_{2},\ldots,A_{n} be subsets of a set S that are not necessarily disjoint. Then the number of elements in the set S\setminus(A_{1}\cup A_{2}\cup\cdots\cup A_{n}) is \left|S\setminus(A_{1}\cup A_{2}\cup\cdots\cup A_{n})\right|=\left|S\right|+ \sum_{t=1}^{n}(-1)^{t}\sum_{1\leq j_{1}<j_{2}<\cdots<j_{t}\leq n}\left|A_{j_{1 }}\cap A_{j_{2}}\cap\cdots\cap A_{j_{t}}\right|.

The number of positive integers \leq N that are not divisible by any of the primes p_{1},p_{2},\ldots,p_{n} (§27.2(i)) is N+\sum_{t=1}^{n}(-1)^{t}\sum_{1\leq j_{1}<j_{2}<\cdots<j_{t}\leq n}\left \lfloor\frac{N}{p_{j_{1}}p_{j_{2}}\cdots p_{j_{t}}}\right\rfloor.
With the notation of §26.15, the number of placements of n nonattacking rooks on an n\times n chessboard that avoid the squares in a specified subset B is n!+\sum_{t=1}^{n}(-1)^{t}r_{t}(B)(n-t)!.
The number of ways of placing n labeled objects into k labeled boxes so that at least one object is in each box is k^{n}+\sum_{t=1}^{n}(-1)^{t}\genfrac{(}{)}{0.0pt}{}{k}{t}(k-t)^{n}.
Note that this is also one of the counting problems for which a formula is given in Table 26.17.1.
Elements of N are labeled, elements of K are labeled, and f is onto.
For further examples in the use of generating functions, seeStanley (1997, 1999) and Wilf (1994).
